body: You need to check your typical trace in a test env first, make sure the trace is working as expected. And find out which span(plugin) is the first breaks.
This issue needs to be fixed.
What is your question?
After installed Skywalking on EKS Kubi am not seeing data on Skywaking dashboad
Do you set the mixer adopter or open als?
I have followed this document https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kubernetes/tree/master/archive to install Skywalker on EKS.

I have installed below yaml file tto push metrics into Skywalking.

skywalking-kubernetes/archive/6/6.0.0-beta/istio.

01-metrictemplate.yml
02-skywalingadapter.yml
03-operator_cfg.yml

@wu-sheng ,

Is there any other steps to set mixer adopter ? Can you please help me on this issue.

@wu-sheng ,

As part of istio setup we have installed Prometheus for istio on eks.

Do you run this? https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kubernetes/tree/master/archive#setup-istio-to-send-metric-to-oap-1 

Istio mixer adopter should be config. And you could check istio mixer log.
Thanks for replying @wu-sheng ,Yes i have performed below url all steps on EKS/Istio but still i dont see istio metrics on Skywalking dash board.
followed url steps : https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kubernetes/tree/master/archive#setup-istio-to-send-metric-to-oap-1

Mail list: dev@skywalking.apache.org. Mail to dev-subscribe@skywalking.apache.org, follow the reply to subscribe the mail list.

Go to there, release process only happens there.

> 2 I want to know more about background authentication document. When will sw team improve 'backend-token-auth.md' ?

No such thing today. If you want, we could accept contribution by copying codes from 5.x.
I can't tell why from your logs, only thing is your es is not working.
If you are manipulating header by yourself, then it is your responsibility to propagate skywalking's header. `key` is `sw6`.
Why do you want this? Self telemetry is about checking the health and payload, rather than exporting. There is an exporter module, if you want, implement that to Prometheus.
If you want, we could discuss about the contribution plan for that exporter, but don't use telemetry for this.
If you are familiar with istio, you need to learn about istio mixer, check the istio mixer logs, at least, you make sure mixer bypass adopter is working.
can you provide a demo?  I do not konw how  propagate skywalking's header in my filter.
There is no skywalking demo. We do that in the plugin. Which filter is this, upstream request filter?
I had the same problem. Waiting...
@csullh Have you solved it?

@hi-sb，I am trying.  I found if my filter working,the header 'sw6' will lost. if I disable my filter, ,the header 'sw6' have value.I think if I do not modify the plugin, I must be import skywalking6 api in my filter to manually set the header 'sw6' .
@csullh Did you get the header information he transmitted? Can you write it in the comments?
@hi-sb, I found I can not transmit the traceid even I set header 'sw6'  like '1-NjAzLjg2LjE1Njc3NTUzMDQ4NzEwMDAx-NjAzLjk1LjE1Njc3NTUzMDU3MTQwMDAw-0-603-603-xxxxxxx'.

@csullh It looks like a string connected by'-'characters. Among them, some things are coded by base64.

> Skywalking creates index template, new index created driven by data. So, if template is there, it should create automatically.

Can you help analyze where the problem is most likely to be
I think this can be included in 6.4.0
SkyWalking is using JVM feature, not related to how you package codes.

Please check the header, there is a key named `sw6` in it. If you filter works in sync mode, that is the only thing you should do. You mentioned about modify header, so, somehow, skywalking header is not injected or overrided by your OP. 

@zhaoyuguang could you follow up? I wouldn't wait this for 6.4.0, so tagged as 6.5.0
I don't know what happens at your sides, all users are using this, not clear only you showing the error. Sorry. But also, we don't use a local(powerless) es to generate several days data.
Discuss should be in #3411

@csullh Please don't separate the discussion in different places, like #3427. We will miss the context. You are listing the right header of skywalking, we don't have any mechanism to ignore him, so if this lost, trace breaks. Need to dig more about what happens when this filter works.
@kezhenxu94 Moving this to next milestone. It is not related to feature, so don't matter so much.

I found the issue and now able to see data on skywalking.
issue is not able to communicate on 11800 port for oap service.
Thanks @wu-sheng
I see old istio EKS services on dashboard only not able to see new created services on Skywalking dashboard.
Why submit the same issue? SkyWalking doesn't monitor service create. You need to change mixer.

@wu-sheng ,This is total new issue,I am able to see data on skywaalking dashboard after fixing the port issue ,But i see only old service data metrics on skywalking not for new created services data metrics on skywalking dashboard.
Give more traffic to new service. That is what you should do.
yes i pushed  lot of traffic on new created services ..I am using sample bookinfo workshop demo application testing.

We are using the same thing too. You may need to check oap debug logs. First check whether receive mixer report of your new service.

Mixer solution is pretty simple one.

Which version of istio are you using? Look like it is an old version, which is not supporting timestamp. We have pushed this long time ago.
We are using Istio 1.2.3 version.

Strange. This looks like something is not working on Istio mixer side. 

> 2019-09-06T18:11:35.896534Z	error	error creating instance: destination='metric.template.istio-system:sw.handler.istio-system(swadapter.adapter.istio-system)', error='fieldEncoder: dimensions - fieldEncoder: value - lookup failed: 'request.time''
2019-09-06T18:11:35.896622Z	error	api	Report failed: 1 error occurred:
* fieldEncoder: dimensions - fieldEncoder: value - lookup failed: 'request.time'

Could you file an issue on Istio? The mixer bypass adopter is what we are using, not built by SkyWalking.

@hanahmily Do you know anything about this?
`request.time` should be always there, I am not following why istio says not there.
@ZackButcher Do you have any clue?

Because we are using different adopter. We are using Istio bypass adopter, your error log seems from there, right? Why it can't get `request.time` is the issue.

Read Istio doc, https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/policy-and-telemetry/attribute-vocabulary/. This key `request.time` is still there.
Grafana thing is not referable, because they are not sharing same data source.
@wu-sheng  ok got it.
If we upgrade istio to latest version from 1.2.3 it will fix ?
@wu-sheng  If we upgrade istio to latest version from 1.2.3 it will fix ?

@nandhyala I was using istio mixer solution only in 1.0.4 and 1.1, today, I am always using ALS, without mixer. So, sorry, haven't to tested these new versions, including 1.2.3. That is why I asked you to check to istio team, they know more than me.
Sure @wu-sheng ,I will check with istio team.
Because you could have multiple parents. Like consuming several messages of MQ in one request. Or batch jobs, which assigned by multiple sources.
The vnode creation rule needs to be improved. @x22x22 Ping me if you have some uncertain things.
Please wait for me to fix this bug before considering release 6.4

When ref is missing, we need to create
1. Target spanId in the target segment id, with parentSegmentId = 0.
1. spanId = 0 in the target segment id, with parentSegmentId = -1. 

For parent span, we should follow same rule, if span is not exist, create parent span and root span(spanid = 0)

All these vnode should only be added when it is not existing(or created before)

您好，这个问题太痛了，每次重启skywalking oap就可以了，然后运行一天都没事，过了晚上12点，就不行了，然后又重启oap ，可能不是本地部暑ES不够强大，扛不住。会不会是oap cache与es出现了事务一致性的问题，重启之后就相当于重新load了。



Webb

Set the value of this https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kubernetes/blob/master/helm-chart/6.1.0/templates/oap-deployment.yaml#L94

`SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES` is the system env name for this. Check the https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-starter/src/main/assembly/application.yml#L73-L92 System env names are there.

Also, recommend do quick start at local first, only jdk 8 required to test.

Helm chart doesn't support external elasticsearch instance right now. If you want to use it anyway, oap-deployment should be updated and elasticsearch.enable set to false to remove internal es installed

Let's take care of it in 6.5.0. Seems like a small bug.

Let's talk about this, since a lot of people used to ask about this before.

There are two parts of questions related to MQ.
# Is MQ a good or right way to community with OAP backend?
This question comes out when people think about what happens when the OAP cluster is not powerful enough or offline. 
But I want to ask the questions before answer this.
1. Why do you think OAP should be not powerful enough? As it is not, the speed of data analysis wouldn't catch up with producers(agents). Then what is the point of adding new deployment requirement?
1. Maybe you will argue says, the payload is sometimes higher than usual as there is hot business time. But, my question is how much higher? 
1. If less than 40%, how many resources will you use for the new MQ cluster? How about moving them to new OAP and ES nodes?
1. If higher than 40%, 70%~2x? Then, I could say, your MQ wastes more resources than it saves. Your MQ would support 2x~3x payload, and with 10%-20% cost in general time. Furthermore, in this case, if the payload/throughput are so high, how long the OAP cluster could catch up. I would say never before it catches up, the next hot time event is coming.

Besides all this analysis, why do you want the traces still 100%, as you are costing so many resources? Better than this, we could consider adding a better dynamic trace sampling mechanism at the backend, when throughputs go over the threshold, active the sampling rate to 100%->10% step by step, which means you could get the OAP and ES 3 times more powerful than usual, just ignore the traces at hot time.

# How about MQ metrics data exporter?
I would say, it is already available there. Exporter module with gRPC default mechanism is there. It is easy to provide a new implementor of that module.

Here are my thoughts, hope it helps.
